definition: The time period in European history between the fall of the Roman Empire and the Renaissance, characterized by feudalism, the dominance of the Catholic Church, and the development of Gothic architecture. It is commonly used to refer to this specific historical era.

examples.german: Das Mittelalter war eine Zeit des Wandels.
examples.english: The Middle Ages were a time of change.

examples.german: Die Ritter waren wichtige Figuren im Mittelalter.
examples.english: Knights were important figures in the Middle Ages.

examples.german: Die Pest war eine verheerende Krankheit im Mittelalter.
examples.english: The Black Death was a devastating disease in the Middle Ages.

examples.german: Die Kirche hatte großen Einfluss im Mittelalter.
examples.english: The Church had great influence in the Middle Ages.

examples.german: Die Kunst im Mittelalter war stark von der Religion geprägt.
examples.english: Art in the Middle Ages was heavily influenced by religion.
